radiographic_examinations.findings: A sub-4 mm left lower lobe pulmonary nodule noted; remainder of the lung bases clear. Small hiatal hernia. Liver shows hypodensities likely representing a cyst or hamartoma and hemangiomas. Significant stranding adjacent to the cecum and appendix with an appendicolith at the origin of the appendix. Markedly dilated appendix measuring 1.6 cm with discontinuity of the appendiceal wall compatible with a perforation and a small non-drainable fluid collection indicative of phlegmonous changes or early abscess.
